Posts.Content: catty1 wrote: I feel ill with worry and keep bursting into tears.  For some time I've had a mysterious itch deep in my left breast.  It came and went, and I figured it had something to do with my menstrual cycle.  Yesterday (Friday) the itching was more persistent, and now there is a rash there.  It's 5cm X 2cm, on the lower side of my breast.  I never had such symptoms in my right breast.  There is no swelling, hardness, or dimpling (yet).  I am VERY flat-chested, so it's doubtful to be from moisture.  Of course this developed on a Friday when my Dr's office is closed.  I am scared enough to go to the ER, but I know they'll just tell me to follow up with my own Dr. ASAP.  So I'm waiting with bated breath till Monday, hoping he can see me that day.  I don't want to waste time with a mammogram and just want a biopsy first thing.  Is this reasonable?  I'm so scared.  Thanks for listening.  (My age is 47; no history at all of cancer in my family).  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Petrified I have IBC catty1 catty1

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2011 01:10PM - edited Jul 25, 2011 01:10PM by catty1 Had my Dr. appointment today.  Of course he said it's just a rash and gave me steriod/antifungal cream.  I wish I could feel relieved at that, but I'm not.  He said if it's not better in a few days that he'd refer me to a dermatolgist.  I'd rather just go right for a biopsy!  I don't want to waste any time.  Thanks so much for your concern!
Posts.Title: Petrified I have IBC catty1 catty1

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2011 05:59AM catty1 wrote: Thank you all for your input.  The rash hasn't changed, no better, no worse, but sure is itchy.  I am hoping it is a fungal thing.  I'm a nurse, but it just doesn't look fungal to me.  Any more encouraging words would be great until I can call my Dr. tomorrow.
